casename: Lifestyle 1.99 Pte Ltd v S$1.99 Pte Ltd (trading as ONE.99 SHOP)
coram: Chao Hick Tin JA; L P Thean JA; Yong Pung How CJ
counsel: Hee Theng Fong and Chua Ai Chun (Hee Theng Fong & Co) for the appellants; Morris John, Jupiter Kong and Yvonne Tang (Drew & Napier) for the respondents
tags-parsed: Tort/Passing off/Three elements to prove/Goodwill/Acquisition and evidence of goodwill
Tort/Passing off/Misrepresentation/Whether "ONE.99" descriptive/Relationship between name and nature of business/Intention of respondents to sell products at $1.99

Tort/Passing off/Misrepresentation/Establishment of secondary meaning/Difficulty of showing distinctiveness for descriptive names/Whether appellants took unfair advantage of respondents' name/Whether appellants took adequate measures to distinguish their business/Whether reasonable probability of deception

Tort/Passing off/Unfair competition/Perception that appellants riding on respondents' publicity/Whether tort of unfair competition exists/Whether respondents can claim monopoly to concept of selling goods at $1.99

Tort/Passing off/Misrepresentation/Confusion amongst public that appellants' and respondents' businesses related/Inevitability of misconception when businesses adopt similar descriptive names/Whether desirable to grant respondents their claim
